course_title: Special Topics: Cross-listed: Black Women Who Kill in USHist
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 3 / Seats Avail: 0Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
(Same as AAS 375 1 and WGS 385 7)
(Complete Topic: Black Women Who Kill in US History)
(We will examine notions of race, gender, violence, and justice in history by exploring several cases involving Black women tried for murder. Moving through enslavement, the post-Reconstruction period, and the twentieth century, our class will consider how we might understand American history and culture through Black women's experiences in the criminal justice system. Using cases that include inter- and intra- racial violence, we will read primary and secondary sources, drawing on monographs, trial transcripts, and original press coverage to ultimately obtain a better understanding of citizenship, policing, and justice.)
course_description: Selected topics in history for students in non-history originating (cross-listed) courses. May be repeated for credit when topic varies.
